channel.title: project-news on Pulsar Neighborhood
channel.description: Recent content in project-news on Pulsar Neighborhood

item.title: Apache Pulsar Is #5 in Commits to ASF Projects
item.description: The Apache Software Foundation (ASF) just released its annual blog post called “APACHE by the digits”. In it, there are a lot of interesting facts, like there are over 283 Billion lines of code across 2,300 repositories, which is just amazing.

item.title: Log4Shell Security Update
item.description: Within the last 10 hours (current time 10:00 am Pacific, 10 December 21), there has been a severe RCE 0-day exploit found in the Java library log4j that when used, results in a Remote Code Execution (RCE).

item.title: 9,966 Stars, who will be the 10,000?
item.description: Since the first cut of the code was pushed into GitHub just over 5 years ago and 3 years since Apache Pulsar became a high level project, the Neighborhood has grown incredibly.
